dublin_core.dcvalue: Telemedicine is a relatively new development within the UK but is increasingly useful in many areas of medicine including plastic surgery Plastic surgery centres often work on a hub and spoke basis with many district hospitals referring to one tertiary centre The Queen Victoria Hospital is one such centre receiving calls from more than 28 hospitals in the Southeast of England resulting in approximately 20 referrals a day
Annals of the Royal College of Surgeons of England
Telemedicine in acute plastic surgical trauma and burns.
